pageContext.description: A cast copper alloy awl or tracer, probably dating to the Late Bronze Age (c. 1150-800 BC).  The awl has an almost flat sub-rectangular cross section at the tang end, which  widens to become more rounded in the centre of the awl. The awl then  tapers to a point. There is some debate as to the date of such  awls, which probably first  appeared in the Late Bronze Age but could  conceivably have continued to  have been made until much later; here the  patina does suggests a prehistoric date.
pageContext.imageURL: https://finds.org.uk/images/maritime/607. A Bronze Age Awl Y607.jpg
